title: Fairly heavy rainfall expected in parts of the island today
byline: The Department of Meteorology said that showers will occur at times in the Western, Sabaragamuwa, and North-Western provinces, and in the Galle, Matara, Kandy, and Nuwara Eliya districts.

title: CEB workers’ to continue work-to-rule campaign until midnight today
byline: The Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) Technicians’ Union announced that the ongoing ‘work-to-rule’ trade union action will continue as scheduled until midnight today (24).

title: Ryan Routh found guilty in Trump golf course assassination attempt
byline: The trial of Ryan Wesley Routh came to a dramatic end Tuesday when he tried to stab himself in the neck with a pen after a Florida jury found him guilty of attempting to assassinate Donald Trump last year on a golf course.

title: Nasa plans first crewed Moon mission in 50 years for February 2026
byline: Nasa has said it hopes to send astronauts on a ten-day trip around the Moon as soon as February.

title: Govt to establish policies ensuring communities can live without hindrance – PM
byline: The Prime Minister, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya, stated that it is the government’s aim to establish policies in a way that enables every community to carry on their cultural, personal, and political lives without any hindrance.

title: Sagara Kariyawasam issues stern warning to ex-MP Thisakutti Arachchi
byline: Sri Lanka Podujana Peramuna (SLPP) General Secretary and Attorney-at-Law Sagara Kariyawasam has issued a stern warning to former Parliamentarian Thisakutti Arachchi, urging him to refrain from making irresponsible statements at public meetings.

title: Super Typhoon Ragasa kills 14 in Taiwan, leaves 124 missing
byline: Fourteen people have died in Taiwan’s popular tourist hub in the eastern county of Hualien, with 124 missing after a barrier lake in the mountains overflowed to deluge a town during a typhoon, the fire department said on Wednesday.

title: CBSL decides to keep policy rate unchanged
byline: The Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) has decided to maintain the Overnight Policy Rate (OPR) at 7.75%, following its latest Monetary Policy Board meeting held yesterday (23).

title: FM Vijitha Herath meets Jaishankar to reaffirm strong Sri Lanka-India ties
byline: Sri Lanka’s Minister of Foreign Affairs, Vijitha Herath, held bilateral discussions with India’s External Affairs Minister, S. Jaishankar, on the sidelines of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) in the United States, aimed at reaffirming the strong friendship and close cooperation between Sri Lanka and India.

title: China’s latest aircraft carrier showcases new fighter jet launch system
byline: China’s latest and most capable aircraft carrier has used its new electromagnetic catapult to successfully launch three types of aircraft, according to Chinese state media, which released footage of the launches for the first time to mark the technological breakthrough.

title: President Anura Kumara meets UN Human Rights Chief
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake has met with the United Nations High Commissioner for Human Rights Volker Türk and reaffirmed Sri Lanka’s engagement on human rights.

title: President Dissanayake to address UN General Assembly today
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake is scheduled to address the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly (UNGA) today (24).

title: UN report warns AI poses greater threat to women’s jobs
byline: A new United Nations report, “Gender Snapshot 2025”, has highlighted that women’s jobs are disproportionately at risk from artificial intelligence, with nearly 28% of women’s roles globally threatened, compared to 21% of men’s jobs.

title: Court will be informed if decision made on Gammanpila’s arrest – AG
byline: The Attorney General’s Department today (24) informed the Court of Appeal that if a decision is made to arrest former Minister Udaya Gammanpila, the court will be notified of that decision through a motion, said Ada Derana reporter.

title: 15 new breast cancer cases reported daily in Sri Lanka: NCCP
byline: Approximately 15 new breast cancer cases are reported daily in Sri Lanka, while about three women die each day due to the disease, health authorities have revealed.

title: Indian High Commissioner visits ex-President Mahinda Rajapaksa at Carlton House
byline: High Commissioner of India to Sri Lanka Santosh Jha has visited former President Mahinda Rajapaksa at his private residence in Hambantota today.

title: EU asks Apple, Google and Microsoft what they are doing to tackle finance scams
byline: Apple, Google and Microsoft have been asked by EU tech regulators about the measures they are taking to prevent their platforms being used for financial scams, underscoring Europe’s concern about the cost of online fraud.

title: Govt committed to working with all partners to ensure Indian Ocean remains peaceful: PM Harini
byline: The government is committed to working with all partners to ensure the Indian Ocean remains a peaceful, secure, sustainable, and well-governed region, founded on fairness and cooperation, Prime Minister Dr. Harini Amarasuriya stated.

title: President Anura Kumara meets his South African counterpart Cyril Ramaphosa in New York
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently in the United States to attend the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly has met his South African counterpart Cyril Ramaphosa.

title: Is cryptocurrency legal in Sri Lanka? Central Bank Governor explains
byline: Although Sri Lankans cannot use cryptocurrency for transactions in the country, investing in cryptocurrency or virtual currency has no legal impediment due to the non-existence of laws or regulations, according to the Governor of the Central Bank of Sri Lanka (CBSL) Dr. Nandalal Weerasinghe.

title: CMC employee arrested for selling heroin and ‘Ice’
byline: An office assistant of the Colombo Municipal Council (CMC) has been arrested by the Walana Anti-Vice Unit for allegedly selling heroin and crystal methamphetamine (commonly known as Ice) to workers of the council.

title: Ex-Navy Commander Nishantha Ulugetenne further remanded
byline: Former Commander of the Sri Lanka Navy (SLN), Admiral (Retired) Nishantha Ulugetenne, who was arrested by the Criminal Investigation Department (CID), has been further remanded.

title: Digitalization can bring significant transformation to education: PM Harini
byline: The Digital Task Force was appointed to facilitate education reform and that digitalization can bring a significant transformation to the education sector in the country, said Prime Minister and Minister of Education, Higher Education, and Vocational Training, Dr. Harini Amarasuriya.

title: UK police arrest man over cyberattack that affected European airports
byline: British police said on Wednesday a man had been arrested as part of an investigation into a ransomware attack against Collins Aerospace, owned by RTX , which knocked check-in systems at airports offline and caused widespread travel disruption across Europe.

title: Jimmy Kimmel defends free speech as he returns to late-night television from suspension
byline: Jimmy Kimmel returned to U.S. late-night television on Tuesday defending political satire against Trump administration “bullying”, six days after his on-air remarks about the murder of right-wing activist Charlie Kirk led Walt Disney to suspend his show.

title: LCs worth USD 1.5 billion opened for vehicle imports so far in 2025
byline: Local banks have opened USD 1,570 million worth of Letters of Credit (LCs) as of September 16, 2025, for the importation of motor vehicles, according to Finance Ministry officials.

title: X-Press Pearl disaster: Ship’s agent pays $1 mln out of $1 bln damages to Sri Lanka
byline: A Singapore-registered ship’s Sri Lanka agent paid US$1 million out of US$1 billion damages awarded for causing the island’s worst pollution, a litigant told AFP on Wednesday.

title: CEB workers decide against strike action but to continue work-to-rule campaign
byline: The ongoing ‘work-to-rule’ campaign launched by several trade unions attached to the Ceylon Electricity Board (CEB) will continue beyond midnight today (24).

title: Police release list of contact numbers to inform on drugs-related incidents
byline: Police have released a list of contact numbers for the members of the public to inform on narcotics-related incidents.

title: Over 1,000 complaints on child abuse reported in first seven months of 2025: Minister
byline: Over 1,000 complaints related to child abuse have been reported in the first seven months of this year, according to Minister of Women and Child Affairs, Saroja Savithri Paulraj.

title: Three people shot at immigration detention facility in Dallas
byline: Three people have been shot at an Immigration and U.S. Customs Enforcement detention facility in Dallas and the shooter is dead from a self-inflicted gunshot wound, the agency’s director said.

title: Solid waste recycling centers to be established across Sri Lanka
byline: A program has been initiated to establish solid waste recycling centers at local government institutions to facilitate the conversion of solid waste into recyclable materials.

title: ASPI closes at new all-time high today
byline: The All Share Price Index (ASPI) of the Colombo Stock Exchange (CSE) closed at an all-time high after gaining over 55 points today (24).

title: Accomplice of ‘Midigama Ruwan’ arrested with three T-56 firearms during STF operation
byline:
Accomplice of ‘Midigama Ruwan’ arrested three T-56 firearms during STF operation
An accomplice of underworld figure ‘Midigama Ruwan’ has been arrested along with firearms during an operation carried out in Weligama this afternoon, police stated.

title: Sri Lanka named No. 1 destination to visit in October
byline: Sri Lanka has been ranked the number one destination to visit in the month of October by global travel magazine Time Out which released its annual list of the world’s top travel spots for the month.

title: Japan PM says Palestine state recognition ‘when not if’
byline: Japan’s prime minister told the United Nations on Tuesday that Tokyo’s recognition of the State of Palestine was only a question of time, saying he was “indignant” at recent comments by Israeli officials.

title: Insurance compensation for death of migrant worker increased
byline: The insurance compensation granted if a Sri Lankan worker employed abroad dies during their employment has been increased up to Rs. 2 million.

title: What’s ex-President Ranil’s next political move?
byline: Former President Ranil Wickremesinghe is reportedly preparing to travel overseas due to health reasons, according to informed sources.

title: Printing of modular materials for Grade 1 and Grade 6 students underway
byline: The printing of required modular materials for Grade 1 and Grade 6 students for the year 2026 is currently underway, the Secretary to the Ministry of Education, Nalaka Kaluwewe has confirmed.

title: NTB to acquire HSBC Sri Lanka’s retail banking business for Rs. 18 billion
byline: Nations Trust Bank PLC (NTB) has entered into a binding Sale and Purchase Agreement with HSBC, acting through its Sri Lanka Branch (HSBC Sri Lanka), to acquire its retail banking business carried out in Sri Lanka for a consideration of LKR 18 billion and applicable taxes if any.

title: China evacuates nearly 2 million as super typhoon Ragasa nears landfall
byline: Chinese authorities evacuated 1.9 million residents from the southern Guangdong province as super typhoon Ragasa, the most powerful storm of the year, barreled toward China with winds reaching 241 kph and waves higher than lampposts.

title: Tariffs and conflict causing major volatility in shipping industry, says UN trade agency
byline: The shipping industry is experiencing major volatility amid rising geopolitical tensions and disruptions caused by a wave of new tariffs, according to a report published on Wednesday by the U.N. Trade and Development agency.

title: President hold talks with US Special Envoy on South Asia Sergio Gor in New York
byline: President Anura Kumara Dissanayake, who is currently in the United States to attend the 80th session of the United Nations General Assembly has met with US President Donald Trump’s Special Envoy for South and Central Asian affairs and Director of the White House Presidential Personnel Office Sergio Gor in New York.
